corrections.explanation: "work time" is slightly awkward. Native speakers more commonly use phrases like "working hours" or "hours of work".

corrections.input: I apologize for not being able to show up today’s meeting. My parents in law visited us from Edmonton today and I got carried away and forgot the meeting. I’m so sorry for that.
corrections.correctedText: I apologize for missing today’s meeting. My parents-in-law visited us from Edmonton earlier today, and I got caught up and forgot about the meeting. I’m so sorry for that.

corrections.correction: apologize for not being able to show up -> apologize for missing
corrections.explanation: The phrase "not being able to show up" is slightly awkward. Native speakers more commonly use phrases like "not showing up" or "not being available".
adding think kind of subtle time reference makes the sentence smoother that aligns with conversational flow and clarifies when the event occurred
The phrase "carried away" is slightly awkward. Native speakers more commonly use "caught up".
